caption_text: The experimental results of series A, shown in Fig. 2, indicate a division into four basicS regions. These regions differ from each other by the mechanism controlling the reaction rate in the pellets. In region I, the mixing within the reactor is slow and ineffective, Mass transfer is controlled by external resistance.

These regions differ from each other by the mechanism controlling the reaction rate in the pellets.
In region I, the mixing within the reactor is slow and ineffective, Mass transfer is controlled by external resistance.

caption_text: The solid line in Fig. 2 is a least square curve fitting for the experimental results. A comparison with predictions of (17) and (19) is, of course, possible only in regions II, III and IV. The actual intraparticte velocity field is far more complex than the simplified uniform stream assumed for the derivation of Section 3.

caption_text: The results of series B are shown in Fig. 3. Again, we notice the quantitative deviation from curves evaluated using eqn (19), primarily due to the differences between the assumed and actual velocity fields and the quasi- steady state analysis. The qualitative characteristics are nevertheless in full agreement and are not obvious.
